sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of natural disaster occurring in a region
message_1: A region has a 1 in 50 chance of experiencing a devastating earthquake in any given year. What is the probability that the region will experience at least one devastating earthquake in the next 10 years?
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can first find the probability that the region will not experience any devastating earthquakes in the next 10 years and then subtract that probability from 1 to find the probability of experiencing at least one devastating earthquake.

The probability of not experiencing a devastating earthquake in any given year is 49/50 (since there's a 1/50 chance of experiencing one). For the region to not experience any devastating earthquakes in the next 10 years, this would have to happen 10 times in a row.

So, the probability of not experiencing any devastating earthquakes in the next 10 years is (49/50)^10.

Now, to find the probability of experiencing at least one devastating earthquake in the next 10 years, we subtract this probability from 1:

Probability of at least one devastating earthquake = 1 - (49/50)^10

Using a calculator, we find:

(49/50)^10 ≈ 0.8174

1 - 0.8174 ≈ 0.1826

So, the probability of the region experiencing at least one devastating earthquake in the next 10 years is approximately 0.1826, or 18.26%.
